text: In DynamoDB, a secondary index is a data structure that contains a subset of attributes from a table, along with an alternate key to support ____ operations.
In regard to DynamoDB, what is the Global secondary index?
choiceList: A. An index with a hash and range key that can be different from those on the table
B. An index that has the same range key as the table, but a different hash key
C. An index that has the same hash key and range key as the table
D. An index that has the same hash key as the table, but a different range key

text: In regard to DynamoDB, can I modify the index once it is created?
choiceList: A. Yes, if it is a primary hash key index
B. Yes, if it is a Global secondary index
D. Yes, if it is a local secondary index
commentList: B: (AWS now allows you to modify global secondary indexes after creation)

text: When thinking of DynamoDB, what are true of Global Secondary Key properties?
choiceList: A. The partition key and sort key can be different from the table.
B. Only the partition key can be different from the table.
C. Either the partition key or the sort key can be different from the table, but not both.
D. Only the sort key can be different from the table.
